veterinary_certificate_no: Take the certificate number from item 1.5 "Certificate / Certificate No" or from the footer "Certificate Number ...". Keep the string exactly as on the form and add it to veterinary_certificate_no.
veterinary_certificate_date: Find place and date of issue in the line "PLACE AND DATE OF ISSUE" (bottom of document, e.g., "TALCAHUANO 02/07/2025"). Keep the format as in the source and add the date to veterinary_certificate_date.
producer: Extract the establishment name from item 3.1 "Name (No) and address of establishment..." (producer/plant; often includes Establishment No). Keep the full legal name in one line and add it to producer.
buyer: Take the consignee from item 1.2 "Name and address of consignee". Keep the name (and address if shown) in one line and add to buyer.
exporter: Take the consignor/exporter from item 1.1 "Name and address of consignor". Keep the name (and address if shown) in one line and add to exporter.
vessel: In item 1.3 "Means of transport" extract the vessel name without the container number (e.g., "MSC TAKORADI VIII NX528R"). Keep in one line and add to vessel.
container_no: In item 1.3 find container number(s) in format 4 letters + 7 digits (e.g., "BMOU9288991"). If multiple, join with "; ". Add to container_no.
veterinary_seal: From item 2.6 "Number of seal" extract the veterinary/health seal number(s) if provided as a general block. If multiple, join with "; ". Add to veterinary_seal.
country_of_origin: Determine the country of origin from item 1.6 (competent authority/country) or origin wording in the template; record the country only (e.g., "CHILE"). Add to country_of_origin.
products: The "products" block is expandable: create product_1, product_2, ... for each line/batch in sections 2.1-2.8. Keep order. If an attribute is given once for the whole batch (e.g., one seal or one Latin species), duplicate it in the relevant product_i. In token_refs include references to the source fragments used.
products[*].name_product: Item 2.1 "Name of the product". Extract the commercial name (e.g., "ATLANTIC SALMON ... FILLETS" without the Latin species) and add to products[i].name_product.
products[*].latin_name: Item 2.1: if a Latin species name appears in parentheses (e.g., "SALMO SALAR"), extract it and add to products[i].latin_name. If none, leave empty.
products[*].packages: Item 2.4 "Number of packages". Extract the count. If multiple values (by batches), join with "; " in one line. Add to products[i].packages.
products[*].net_weight: Item 2.5 "Net weight (kg)". Extract net weight in the original format (dot/comma). If multiple values, join with "; ". Add to products[i].net_weight.
products[*].factory_number: Item 2.7 "Identification marks". Extract the establishment registration number (e.g., "10751"). If multiple, join with "; ". Add to products[i].factory_number.
products[*].date_of_production: Item 2.2 "Date of production". If multiple dates, join with "; " in one line. Add to products[i].date_of_production.
products[*].seal_number: Item 2.6 "Number of seal". Extract the seal number(s) for the item. If one number applies to the whole batch, also duplicate it to document-level veterinary_seal. If multiple values, join with "; ". Add to products[i].seal_number.
products[*].unit_box: This field corresponds to item 2.3 "Type of package". Extract the package type (e.g., "CARDBOARD BOXES"). Keep the wording as on the form and add to products[i].unit_box.
